train_df = pd.read_csv("../Data/raw-data/train.csv")

```{python}

train_df2 = pd.read_csv("../Data/raw-data/train2.csv")

train_df2.head()

```

```{python}

fake_tweets_df = pd.read_csv("../Data/raw-data/fake_tweets2.csv")

# Rename the 'tweet' column to 'message'
fake_tweets_df.rename(columns={'tweet': 'message'}, inplace=True)

# Reorder columns to place 'sentiment' first and 'message' second
fake_tweets_df = fake_tweets_df[['sentiment', 'message']]

print(fake_tweets_df)

```


```{python}

# Concatenate the two dataframes vertically since they have the same structure
updated_train_df = pd.concat([fake_tweets_df, train_df2], ignore_index=True)

# Save the updated dataframe to a new CSV file
updated_train_df.to_csv("../Data/raw-data/updated_train.csv", index=False)
print(updated_train_df)

```
